definitions.definition: The focusing on the text of written law to the exclusion of the intent of law, elevating strict adherence to law over justice , mercy , grace and common sense .
A belief that salvation is attained or maintained by adherence to the requirements of moral law; salvation by works rather than by faith alone.
A legal axiom , term or rule .

main_definition: The focusing on the text of written law to the exclusion of the intent of law, elevating strict adherence to law over justice , mercy , grace and common sense .
secondary_definitions: ( religion ) A belief that salvation is attained or maintained by adherence to the requirements of moral law; salvation by works rather than by faith alone.
A legal axiom , term or rule .
( Chinese philosophy ) Alternative letter-case form of Legalism .
